cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 350 mi NE of the north-western Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west toward the north-western Bahamas and Florida today and Wednesday, then turning west-northwest across central/northern Florida and into southern Georgia before recurving north-northeast up the U.S. Southeast coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast (between Boca Raton and the Flagler/Volusia County line)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Altamaha Sound GA to Savannah River GA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Flagler/Volusia County Line FL to Altamaha Sound GA (Tropical-Storm Warning south of the port)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast north of Palm Beach through Georgia and South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible late Thursday as the center moves across southern Georgia.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level possible along the Georgia coast, including the Savannah River entrance, especially around high tide Thursday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–4 inches of rain expected Thursday into early Friday with localized urban or poor-drainage flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and minor coastal erosion are likely ahead of and during the storm passage.
